Package Restaurant

Class Restaurant

java.lang.Object
Restaurant.Restaurant
public class Restaurant extends Object
this is an entity class throughout the duration of application runtime, only one instance of this class is created stores main information about the restaurant

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Restaurant()
    constructor for restaurant reads the text files "tables.txt", "staff.txt", "transhistday.txt" and "reservationsrecords.txt" based on the information in the textfiles, objects are created and arraylists are updated.

    • reserveTable

      public int reserveTable(LocalDateTime arrivalDateTime, int pax, String name, int tel) throws IOException
      Returns the table id for date & time entered. Returns -1 if no table is found.
      Parameters:
      pax - the number of guests. table capacity should be greater than or equal to this.
      name - the name of the customer making reservation
      tel - the phone number of the customer
      Returns:
      returns first available table, doesnt iterate through all unless no table. -1 if no table is found.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getAvailableTables

      public ArrayList<Table> getAvailableTables(int pax, LocalDateTime currentDateTime) throws IOException
      Parameters:
      pax - checks tables against the pax of incomers
      currentDateTime - gets the current dateTime from the main()
      Returns:
      returns an arraylist of Table objects that have status=FREE
      Throws:
      IOException

      public Table getTableFromReservationHashMap(LocalDateTime dateTimeToCheck, int tel)

      Parameters:

      tel - reservation telephone number

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      string that contains each table and its respective status and capacity as well as the total number of free, occupied and reserved tables.
